= Installation Guide =

*uml@J* is available in the Maven central repository.

In order to use it, you must add two dependencies in your pom.xml:
 * org.umlatj:umlatj-core:0.1.0
 * org.aspectj:aspecjrt:1.6.8

Additionally, you must activate the AspectJ Maven Plugin in the build section and add org.umlatj:umlatj-core as aspect library:

{{{
<plugin>
	<groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
	<artifactId>aspectj-maven-plugin</artifactId>
	<version>1.3</version>
	<configuration>
		<source>1.6</source>
		<target>1.6</target>
		<aspectLibraries>
			<aspectLibrary>
				<groupId>org.umlatj</groupId>
				<artifactId>umlatj-core</artifactId>
			</aspectLibrary>
		</aspectLibraries>
	</configuration>
	<executions>
		<execution>
			<goals>
				<goal>compile</goal>
				<goal>test-compile</goal>
			</goals>
		</execution>
	</executions>
</plugin>
}}}

== AJDT support ==

Unfortunately, latest versions of m2eclispe don't support AJDT anymore (https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/MNGECLIPSE-1944).

Instead, you can use the maven-eclipse-plugin which supports AJDT. Just add the following declaration in the build section, and run
	 `mvn eclipse:eclipse` 

{{{
<plugin>
	<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
	<artifactId>maven-eclipse-plugin</artifactId>
	<version>2.8</version>
	<configuration>
		<!-- AJDT support -->
		<ajdtVersion>1.5</ajdtVersion>
		
		<!-- m2eclipse compatibility -->
		<additionalProjectnatures>
			<additionalProjectnature>org.maven.ide.eclipse.maven2Nature</additionalProjectnature>
		</additionalProjectnatures>
		<additionalBuildcommands>
			<buildCommand>
				<name>org.maven.ide.eclipse.maven2Builder</name>
				<arguments>
				</arguments>
			</buildCommand>
		</additionalBuildcommands>
		
	</configuration>
</plugin>

}}}
